title: Use uploaded logo exactly and enforce best-practice SEO (on-page + technical) across all pages

requirements.text: Use the uploaded logo image exactly as-is everywhere the brand logo or favicon is displayed, with no visual modifications (no recolors, filters, cropping differences, or alternate marks). Ensure the header/footer logo uses the same uploaded asset and the favicon references the full-logo asset correctly from the HTML head.

quotes: use the logo exactly as logo.

acceptanceCriteria: The header and footer render the same uploaded logo image file (single source of truth), and it is not altered via CSS filters or alternate assets.
The favicon links in frontend/index.html reference the full uploaded logo favicon assets and load correctly in modern browsers.
No other logo variants are introduced (no monochrome/flat versions) unless they are byte-identical conversions required for favicon sizing.

requirements.text: Enforce strict on-page SEO rules across ALL pages (Home, Services, SEO Services, Logo Design Services, Blog index, Blog post, Blog editor, About, Profile): meta title must start with the page’s primary keyword and be <60 characters; meta description must include the primary keyword and be <160 characters; each page must have a single clear H1 and a logical H2–H6 hierarchy with no skipped heading levels used purely for styling.

quotes: Then check SEO (onpage - Primary keyword use in start of Meta tile and lenght of meta titel below 60 character, Primary keyword uned in meta description,<lenght less than 160 chracters> content , H1, H2...H6 for all page, technical SEO inluding UX, Sitemap, ronots.txt, Richsnippet, schema etc)

acceptanceCriteria: Every route sets a unique meta title and meta description that meet the length and keyword-placement constraints (<60 title chars; <160 description chars; primary keyword included; keyword at start of title).

Home page continues to target primary keyword "SEO Agency" with supporting keyword "USA" in title, H1, and intro copy; Logo Design Services page continues to target primary keyword "Logo Design Services" with supporting keyword "USA" similarly.
Each page has exactly one H1 and uses headings semantically (H2 sections under H1; H3 subsections under H2; no heading levels used only for visual sizing).

requirements.text: Add technical SEO assets for crawling and indexing: generate and serve a static /sitemap.xml and /robots.txt from the frontend, covering all public, indexable routes in the app, and referencing the sitemap from robots.txt.

quotes: technical SEO inluding UX, Sitemap, ronots.txt, Richsnippet, schema etc

acceptanceCriteria: /robots.txt is accessible and includes a Sitemap directive pointing to /sitemap.xml.
/sitemap.xml is accessible, valid XML, and includes canonical URLs for all public pages (at minimum: /, /services, /services/seo, /services/logo-design, /blog, /about).
Routes that should not be indexed (e.g., authenticated/editor utility pages if applicable) are excluded from sitemap and disallowed in robots.txt as appropriate.

requirements.text: Harden the SEO metadata implementation so it reliably produces correct, non-duplicated tags on navigation: ensure canonical, Open Graph, and Twitter tags are updated per-route; ensure JSON-LD is injected deterministically without stale data between route transitions.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating between routes updates document.title, meta description, canonical, OG, and Twitter tags to match the current page (no duplicates and no stale values from prior pages).
JSON-LD changes with the current route and does not retain previous page schema content after navigation.
All pages continue to include appropriate structured data (site-wide Organization/WebSite; BlogPosting on blog post pages; FAQPage on the SEO Services page).

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, and anything under frontend/src/components/ui.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add a migration file if existing stable state must change.
nonGoals: Adding new services/pages beyond the existing routes and content structure.
Integrating third-party SEO/audit services, external crawlers, or server-side rendering.
Changing authentication provider (must remain Internet Identity).
